sect1.title: Setting up your system keyboard layout
sect1.para: The &yast; System Keyboard Layout module lets you define the default keyboard layout for the system (also used for the console). Users can modify the keyboard layout in their individual X sessions, using the desktop's tools.

step.para: Start the &yast; System Keyboard Configuration dialog by clicking Hardware System Keyboard Layout in &yast;. Alternatively, start the module from the command line with sudo yast2 keyboard.
Select the desired Keyboard Layout from the list.
Try the selected keyboard layout in the Test text box.
If the result is as expected, confirm your changes and close the dialog.

Advanced keyboard settings can be configured in SystemSysconfig EditorHardwareKeyboard. Here you can specify the keyboard rate and delay settings as well as enable or disable NumLock, CapsLock, and ScrollLock.
